titleStmt.title: Two letters written by Mr Harris in vindication of himselfe from the known slanders of an unknown author. To my reverend friend M. Harris. Sir, it will not (I hope) offend you to see your private letters made publique, it concernes you, and others, to vindicate your selves in the catching age, and the sooner 'tis done the better, chide me if you will, yet I will be yours still, W.T. May 2. 1648.
titleStmt.author: Harris, Robert, 1581-1658.

titleStmt.title: Two letters written by Mr Harris in vindication of himselfe from the known slanders of an unknown author. To my reverend friend M. Harris. Sir, it will not (I hope) offend you to see your private letters made publique, it concernes you, and others, to vindicate your selves in the catching age, and the sooner 'tis done the better, chide me if you will, yet I will be yours still, W.T. May 2. 1648.
titleStmt.author: Harris, Robert, 1581-1658.

notesStmt.note: A reply to: Barlow, Thomas. Pegasus.
Place of publication and printer's name from Wing.
The letter on the title page is attributed to Harris himself.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
